page.title: 19CHANGES IN STEWARTBY
page.content: Written by Steven Hunt aged 14 1. Even though there is polution and people complain the amount does not reach lethal levels. One suggestion to improve the problem was to have a very tall chimney which would take the sulphur far up into the atmosphere. However, politicians would not give permission and so the chimneys still remain as they are. 2. Thirty years ago all of the villagers worked at LBC, but today only half still work there. That is because more people were needed thirty years ago. Today machines do the work of many men. 3. In December 1980 Big Bertha, the biggest chimney at Kempston Hardwick was demolished.
